column4: hey guys.. I'm using  Ubuntu 8.04 - the Hardy Heron. I want to upgrade to latest version.
how to do that?
I believe the command is "sudo aptitude dist-upgrade" or just use the update manager
somebody correct me if Im wrong
: tried
but nothing is happening.
$sudo apt-get update
$sudo apt-get dist upgrade
I'm afraid that's all I know, i'm realtively new to linux as wel
does anyone know the quickest way to add a new harddrive to Ibex?
it has 3 NTFS partitions which I want to keep for now, and I want to mount all of them in a certain dir
oh and I want to use quotas on it
the command should be "sudo apt-get dist-upgrade" exactly like that
if you're still looking to upgrade
yeah.
I did the same, but no result.
what did happen ?
I followed the procedure mentioned here http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/upgrading
but still no result.
its not upgrading
I want to upgrade from 8.04 to 8.10. I followed the procedure mentioned here http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/upgrading . its not upgrading.
I want to upgrade from 8.04 to 8.10. I followed the procedure mentioned here http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/upgrading . its not upgrading. pls help!!
afraid thats all I know, you could try downloading the image for Ibex and burning that to a cd, then boot from it and install/upgrade
